outputs.description: By 2017, the management, coordination, monitoring and evaluation of the implementation of the Education Sectorial Programme atcentral, decentralized and community levels are supported by reliable statistical data, disaggregated by sex and area of residence(rural / urban), produced and disseminated in time

By 2017, in 11 prefectures benefiting from the complete package of program interventions, access and retention of girls withpreschool age (4-5 years) and school age (6-11 years) and girls over school-aged  (10-14 years), including in emergency situations,to quality preschool and primary education services, in healthy environments, protecting and fulfilling the physical and Communitydimensions of the child-friendly school approach,  girl-friendly  school APPROACH are increased  by 6 points,  20 points and 25points respectively.

By 2017, the Education Sectorial Programme is updated   policies and strategies aiming to feed and/ or operationalize it  inorder to accelerate access, maintenance and children's successfulness  in school and their completion of primary schooling,particularly the mos tvulnerable girls and children , including in emergency situations, are developed / updated and with increasedfinancial allocations from the Government, local authorities and development partners

By 2017, in 19 prefectures and in the peri-urban area of Conakry, Dubreka  and Coyah, innovations and gender sensitive teachingmethods and focused on learners are effectively implemented, gradually scaled up with special focus on the qualification ofteachers, availability of teaching materials and participation of girls and boys, and improve to 10 points the successfullness ofstudent learnings

D'ici fin 2012, les connaissances, attitutdes et pratiques des programmes cibles sur les 6/7 PFE regionales prioritaires sontpromues, connues et progressivement adaptes par 10% des enfants et des femmes
La proportion des enfants infectés recevant des ARVs passent de 15 à 30%
GUINEA COUNTRY PROGRAMME 2007 - 2010

By the end of 2017, state services (health, education, security, social and judicial protection) and civil societyorganizations,  in the targeted areas, are able to prevent and respond to violence against girls and a boys (with particularattention on birth Registration, FGM and child marriages and early pregnancy) including in emergencies
Les enfants et les femmes bénéficient d'une réponse pertinente en cas de situation instable  et leur accompagnement en période deconsolidation de la paix est assuré

By the end of 2017, reliable data, disaggregated by sex, capturing  effectiveness and impact of preventive, curative andpromotional interventions with high impact on health of mother and child are regularly produced and used at all levels
NC IR 1  : Effective and efficient 2012 systems that are necessary to ad equately manage risks and achieve programme results
D'ici fin 2012, 55% des enfants de 6 mois sont allaites exclusivement et 80% des enfants de 6 à 9 mois reçoivent les aliments decomplément appropries
IR 4: BZS 2012
PRIOR-YEAR COMMITMENTS

IR2- Education Prescolaire 2012         enfants du primaire étudient dans un environnement physique d'apprentissage conforme àl'approche école amie des enfants   1200 enfants bénéficient d'une éducation préscolaire de qualité dans des centres dontl'environnement physique est conforme à l'approche école amie des enfants  25 000 jeunes et adultes savent lire, écrire et calculeret appliquer cet apprentissage dans leur vie quotidienne

By the end of 2015, an additional 1.5 million population uses drinking water and sanitation services, and improves hygienepractices such as washing hands with soap and water treatment at home in communities, schools and health facilities indisadvantaged areas

By the end of 2017, reliable data disaggregated by sex and age that provide information on access to safe water and sanitation,the management of quality of household water and hand washing are regularly produced and used for improved WASH programming.

By the end of 2017, political, programmatic and budgetary dialogue with partners of  the sector at all levels  is enhanced forcost efficient approaches to improve the environment and reduce the incidence of waterborne diseases for children, including inemergency situations .

IR2- A la fin de 2012, une population additionnelle de 3% dans les huit régions administratives utilisent de l'eau potable, ontaccès aux installations sanitaires de base et ont adopté des pratiques essentielles d'hygiène.
IR3- VIH 2012

Improving access to water, sanitation and hygiene of the people and save the lives of children under 5 suffering from severe acutemalnutrition in regions of Nzerekore (area affected by the floods) and of Kankan( facing a nutritional crisis and flooding)
New Element
03-Education non formelle

End 2017, the Government has adopted a pro-poor programming and budgeting approach, gender sensitive and equitable at nationallevel and a planning approach that puts boys and girls at the center of national development processes and reduces inequalities

By the end of 2017, data collection systems and mechanisms for monitoring of social indicators are functional and responsive toequity, gender and human rights. A framework for monitoring and evaluation of equity is implemented and measures the lifting ofbarriers and bottlenecks limiting the improvement of living conditions of children and women.
Emergency preparedness and response

By end 2017, at least 70% of children especially those living in areas of difficult access, receive adequate health care forpriority diseases, including malaria, acute respiratory infections (ARI) and diarrheal diseases including in emergency situationsand at least 50% of households know and adopt the Essential health Family Practices with involvement of men and an increasedparticipation of women in health care decisions

L'Administration centrale et deconcentrée disposent de compétences pour une planification stratégique, de suivi -évaluation desobjectifs du programme et pour l'analyse continue de la situation des enfants et des femmes d'ici fin 2012

IR1- Enseignement Primaire 2012         pertinentes sont disponibles et orientent les actions des régions pour accroître l'accèsdes enfants à l'école, particulièrement les filles et les enfants désavantagés, leur maintien, leur réussite et leur achèvement ducycle d'études primaires de façon à atteindre les valeurs des indicateurs définies à l'horizon 2012.
D'ici fin 2012, les régions et les préfectures disposent de données pertinentes pour une analyse actualisée de la situation desenfants et des femmes

By the end of 2017, the national funding of high-impact interventions for reducing maternal and child mortality due to preventablediseases through vaccination and killing deseases of pregnant women and children, is increased by 10 points of percentage
Au moins 80% des femmes enceintes font la quatrième consultation prénatale et 65% des accouchements sont assistes par du personnelqualifie
IR3- VIH 2012

IR1- Les enfants et les femmes les plus défavorisés des 8 régions administratives développent des capacités pour accroitre leuraccès à l'eau potable et à l'hygiène, tant en période de crise qu'en situation stable, grâce à un mécanisme opérationnel decoordination des actions et des acteurs
D'ici fin 2012,  le taux des enfants ayant un extrait de naissance passe à 65% dans les 8 régions administratives

D'ici fin 2012, un système de protection est mis en place en vue de réduire la vulnérabilité et l'exposition des enfants à toutesformes de violences incluant les Mutilations Génitales Féminines, les grossesses et  les mariages précoces.
01 - PEV-IR 2011                         des enfants cibles sont couverts par les campagnes contre la poliomyélite et la rougeole,et 95% des mères sont vaccinées lors de la campagne contre le TMNN-
95% des enfants de 6 à 59 mois reçoivent la supplémentation en vitamine A et sont déparasités dans les 6 derniers mois. 80% desfemmes enceintes reçoivent la supplémentation en fer et acide folique

By the end of 2017, political and budgetary dialogue is strengthened, and at least 90% of program managers, service providersincluding Community and national level have increased capacity to plan, implement and monitor high impact HIV interventions forchildren, women and adolescents (s) based on equity, gender and analysis of bottlenecks and disparities

By end 2017, at least 90% of HIV positive pregnant women receiving ARVs for PMTCT and the proportion of infected children,including adolescents living with HIV receiving anti retroviral treatment has increased by 15 points in the geographical areascontributing more than half of the unmet needs in PMTCT and pediatric AIDS

By end 2017, at least 60% of adolescents and women, especially the most vulnerable in the geographical areas with increasedvulnerability, acquire knowledge and behaviors to reduce the risk of HIV and increase the demand and use of high-impactinterventions.
Prior-Year Commitments

At the end of 2017,  in the targeted areas, at least 50% of communities experiencing violence, abuse and exploitation againstgirls and boys, strengthen their capacity to prevent, respond and  undertake actions to abandon those practices (with particularattention to FGM /E and early marriage and forced pregnancies and birth registration) and the ability of boys and girls to claimand exercise their rights has increased, including in emergency situations.

By the end of 2017, laws, policies and programs promoting child rights and protection of girls, boys and women - withparticular attention to the most vulnerable - are strengthened and the national budget has increased by 7% for the sector

IR3- Education non formelle 2012        gramme, les effectifs des enfants commençant l'école primaire à l'âge requis augmententde 10%   les effectifs des enfants bénéficiant d'une éducation de seconde chance de qualité sont accrus de 10 %   les  tauxd'abandon et de redoublement sont réduits de 20% et les taux de réussite sont accrus de 20%.

By the end of 2017, a system for collecting and managing data between the central and sub prefectural levels to track birthregistration, violence, exploitation and abuse against to girls and boys is regularly informed by the community-based protectionmechanism  information is used for decision making,

By the end of 2017, the national financial support for the promotion of exclusive breastfeeding and complementary feeding inorder to reduce malnutrition rates is  increased by 10  points of percentage
Les enfants et les femmes bénéficient d'une réponse pertinente en cas de situation instable, en particulier dans la lutte contre lecholera .

By the end of 2017, the rate of exclusive breastfeeding (0-6 months) has increased by 22 points and 30% of children aged 6-23months in particular those from disadvantaged areas, receive acceptable food of supplementation  through the adoption by householdsof Essential Family Practises of nutrition and at least 80% of severe acute malnourished children are screened and receive qualitycare in health facilities and communities including in emergency situations.
By the end of 2017, statistical data, disaggregated by sex, on nutritional status are produced in real time and used for programand strategic decision making

IR1-: Au moins 70% des enfants souffrant de paludisme, d'infections respiratoires aigües et de maladies diarrhéiques reçoiventun traitement de qualité au niveau des structures de santé ou de la communauté
IR3- VIH 2012

By end 2017, at least 80% of children (girls and boys) under one year are fully vaccinated and 95% of target children are coveredby local or national campaigns against polio and measles  85% of pregnant women especially those living in areas with low coverage,are completely vaccinated, make their third EIC and 75% of births are attended by skilled personnel in ten rural districtsincluding in emergency situations

Dans la région, le nombre d'enfants inscrits et maintenus à l'école augmente d'au moins 5% en moyenne avec une réduction de moitié de l'écart de genre, une scolarisation accrue des enfants handicapés, une progressive mise à l'échelle des gouvernements d'enfants, un accroissement d'au moins 10% des enfants encadrés selon l'approche intégrée pour le développement du jeune enfant dans les CEC et d'adolescents fréquentant les centres d'éducation non formelle appuyés par le programme.

IR3:  En fin 2012, environ 150.000 enfants supplémentaires utilisent de l'eau potable, de latrines hygiéniques et du savon pour selaver les mains dans 250 écoles dans toutes les huit régions  administratives.
80% des enfants identifiés comme sévèrement mal nourris sont traités et au moins 85% parmi eux sont déclarés guéris

By the end of 2017, 90% of children (girls / boys) aged 6 to 59 months receive micronutrient supplementation (vitamin A, zinc,iron) and those of 12-59 months are dewormed every 6 months  80% of pregnant women receive iron supplementation / folic acid andthe proportion of households consuming iodized salt has increased by 23 points of percentage
